jobs.title: Business Operations Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Business Operations Associate

Remote Work
Compensation: $95,000 - $100,000 base plus meaningful equity

About Honeydew

Honeydew is transforming dermatological care by delivering seamless, tech-enabled experiences for patients and providers. We blend operational excellence with a human touch to ensure high-quality, accessible dermatology services. As a fast-growing healthcare company, we’re looking for mission-driven teammates who thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments and who want their work to make a real difference.

Role Overview

We’re seeking a high-performing Business Operations Associate to partner directly with our VP of Operations and help scale the systems, processes, and analytics that power our care delivery engine.

This is not your average back-office role. You will be at the center of operations, collaborating across clinical, support, product, and engineering teams to drive efficiency, improve quality, and build infrastructure that supports exceptional patient care. You will have real ownership from day one, the autonomy to make things happen, and a clear path to grow into leadership.

We’re looking for someone who is not just capable, but exceptional. Someone who sets a high bar, thrives in fast-moving environments, and has already proven they can deliver results. If you're ambitious, operationally sharp, and excited to shape a company at the ground level, this is that kind of role.

Key Responsibilities

  • Chief-of-Staff-Style Partnership
    Work directly with the VP of Operations to identify bottlenecks, solve cross-functional problems, and push high-leverage initiatives over the finish line.

  • Business Process Optimization
    Analyze workflows and identify opportunities for automation, scalability, and clarity, especially in clinical and support operations.

  • Operational Analytics
    Build and maintain dashboards and reports to track KPIs, team performance, and quality metrics across the business.

  • System and Tooling Ownership
    Serve as the go-to expert on core tools like Coda, phone software, and task managers. Identify enhancements or integrations that improve performance.

  • Documentation and SOPs
    Own our internal knowledge base, updating SOPs, Coda pages, and internal resources to support quality and consistency at scale.

  • Quality and Performance Monitoring
    Audit task accuracy and process adherence. Help improve workflows that reduce error rates and elevate performance.

  • Special Projects
    Contribute to strategic initiatives across operations, care, and product. Help plan, execute, and track results.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of experience in business operations, healthcare operations, consulting, or a fast-paced analytical role

  • Excellent academic or early-career track record with strong signals of ambition, discipline, and high standards

  • Exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Comfortable with ambiguity and self-directed work

  • Strong data fluency. Confident working in spreadsheets, dashboards, or BI tools such as Tableau

  • Meticulous attention to detail, paired with excellent organizational and communication skills

  • A high degree of ownership and drive. You get things done and do them well

  • Comfortable juggling multiple projects and thriving in a dynamic, fast-paced environment

  • Familiarity with productivity and communication tools such as Google Workspace, Slack, Notion, or Coda

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience in healthcare, dermatology, or care delivery environments

  • Exposure to process improvement methodologies such as Lean or Six Sigma

  • Project management experience or comfort running small cross-functional initiatives

Why This Role, Why Now

You will be joining Honeydew at a moment of rapid growth, where the systems you build and the standards you set will shape the company for years to come. This is a rare opportunity to:

  • Make outsized impact early

  • Learn directly from senior leadership

  • Earn meaningful equity in a fast-scaling healthcare company

  • Grow into a leadership role in operations, strategy, or cross-functional execution

We believe the best people don’t just want a job. They want ownership, challenge, and the chance to do work they’re proud of. That’s exactly what we’re offering.

Why Honeydew

  • A mission-driven team with a strong culture of excellence and ownership

  • A remote-first and flexible working environment

  • Truly competitive compensation including base and equity

  • Opportunities for mentorship, learning, and rapid career growth

jobs.title: Remote Dermatologist (MD/DO) Evenings and Weekends - California
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Honeydew is on a mission to make high-quality, accessible, and affordable skincare available to everyone. We provide personalized care and evidence-based solutions to meet the diverse needs of our patients. Join us in reshaping dermatological care with a compassionate and patient-centered approach.

Job Description:

Honeydew is seeking a dedicated and experienced Dermatologist with a valid US license (must be able to practice in California) to join our remote care team. You’ll play a critical role in delivering virtual dermatology consultations, guiding patients on their skincare journeys, and providing expert advice to meet their needs.

Responsibilities:

  • Through telemedicine, conduct video consultations and message with patients, including assessing, screening, diagnosing, and prescribing medication for patients as necessary

  • Work in close conjunction with other board-certified dermatologists and other members of the care team

  • Adhere to Honeydew guidelines and complete all required compliance and clinical training

  • Handle patient care by answering patient clinical questions, prescribing medication as appropriate, and providing medical guidance as necessary

  • Have the opportunity to provide clinical care for a variety of dermatology conditions, including acne, rosacea, and eczema

Requirements:

  • Active MD or DO license with the ability to practice in California

  • Board Certified in Dermatology

  • Minimum time commitment of 15 hrs per week (preferred) with availability during evenings and weekends

  • 1+ years of experience in a dedicated dermatology practice

  • Excellent written and verbal communication with an emphasis on clarity and compassion

  • Confidence in treating full-spectrum patients with dermatology needs, including experience prescribing a variety of medications such as tretinoin, oral antibiotics, spironolactone, and isotretinoin (accutane)

Job Type:
Part-time, Contract

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule (choose your own hours weekly) with a strong need for evening and weekend coverage

  • Work from anywhere!

  • Dedicated support team available 24/7

  • Best-in-class colleagues committed to helping our amazing patients

jobs.title: Remote Dermatology Nurse Practitioner (NP) Evenings and Weekends - California
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Honeydew is on a mission to make high-quality, accessible, and affordable skincare available to everyone. We provide personalized care and evidence-based solutions to meet the diverse needs of our patients. Join us in reshaping dermatological care with a compassionate and patient-centered approach.

Job Description:

Honeydew is seeking a dedicated and experienced Dermatology Nurse Practitioner (NP) with a valid US license (must be able to practice in California) to join our remote care team. You’ll play a critical role in delivering virtual dermatology consultations, guiding patients on their skincare journeys, and providing expert advice to meet their needs.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct virtual consultations to diagnose and manage a range of dermatological conditions (e.g., acne, eczema, psoriasis, and skin screenings)

  • Provide evidence-based treatment plans and prescribe medications as necessary

  • Educate patients on skincare routines, treatments, and preventative care

  • Collaborate with the care team to ensure seamless patient care and follow-up

  • Maintain accurate and thorough electronic health records of patient interactions

  • Stay current with advancements in dermatology and telemedicine best practices

Qualifications:

  • Active and unrestricted Nurse Practitioner license in the US with the ability to practice in California

  • Certification as an NP (specializing in Dermatology strongly preferred, but not required with relevant experience)

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in dermatology or skincare-related roles

  • Strong knowledge of diagnosing and treating common dermatological conditions

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, especially in virtual settings

  • Comfortable using telehealth platforms and Zoom + GSuite systems

  • Passion for delivering accessible, patient-centered care

  • Availability to work evenings and weekends

Benefits:

  • Fully remote work with flexible scheduling options with a need for evening and weekend coverage

  • Competitive compensation

  • Opportunity to work with a mission-driven company dedicated to skincare accessibility

  • Work alongside world-renowned dermatologists, including Dr. Joel Spitz, author of Genodermatoses

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Are you passionate about helping people navigate their healthcare journey? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can make a real difference? We are seeking a bilingual Care Coordinator who is fluent in both Spanish and English to join our team. Be part of a mission-driven organization dedicated to improving patient outcomes and providing exceptional care.

About Us:

Honeydew is transforming skincare by making it accessible and affordable for everyone. Our team is dedicated to providing compassionate, personalized care to help patients achieve their skin health goals. We’re seeking a highly organized and empathetic Care Coordinator to join our team and be a vital part of our mission.

Job Description:

As a Care Coordinator, you’ll play a critical role in ensuring our patients receive the support and guidance they need throughout their skincare journey. This full-time, fully remote role focuses on patient communication, coordinating care, and managing essential administrative tasks to provide a seamless experience.

Responsibilities:

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for patients, providing guidance, support, and information about their care plans — in both English and Spanish.

  • Answer patient inquiries related to appointments, medical services, and treatment options with empathy and professionalism.

  • Ensure that all patient information and communications are accurately documented in our healthcare system.

  • Act as a liaison between patients, insurance providers, and medical teams to facilitate seamless care delivery.

  • Collaborate with healthcare professionals to develop personalized care plans for patients.

  • Continuously monitor patient progress and provide ongoing support, addressing any concerns or obstacles that arise.

  • Provide translating services between the patient and provider during initial consultations as needed.

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in a healthcare setting, preferably in a care coordination, patient support, or administrative role.

  • Fluency in both Spanish and English is required.

  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.

  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail to manage multiple tasks and priorities.

  • Proficiency in using healthcare management software or similar systems.

  • Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.

  • A positive attitude, empathy, and a genuine passion for helping others.

Benefits:

• Flexible remote schedule.

• Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on patients’ lives.

• Join a mission-driven, innovative team dedicated to revolutionizing skincare.

Pay: $16.00 per hour

jobs.title: Head of People
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mission 💪

Our mission is to ensure that no one in the world has to suffer from a treatable skin disease because of an access issue ever again.

About Honeydew 👋

Honeydew is building an operating system for hundreds of millions of people globally to access expertise and science-backed skin treatments, from prescription to retail.

Our tech-forward dermatology experience helps people with chronic skin conditions access licensed specialists, FDA-approved treatment, and ongoing support in record time (24 hours vs an industry average of 6 months).

Honeydew is the future of skin health — digitally native, scientifically rooted, integrated end-to-end (evaluation + treatments + lab tests), and powered by AI.

Stage 🚀

Since launching, Honeydew has helped 20,000+ people achieve life-changing results with a 5-star rating, and we are growing 5x YoY. We are bringing on our first People leader to help support our team as we scale.

Honeydew is backed by Footwork VC, Rex Woodbury (Daybreak VC), and top-tier angels like Jeff Nadler (Teladoc), Max Mullen (Instacart), Brent Saunders (Allergan), Cory Levy (Z fellows), and Adam Guild (Owner).

Founders ⭐

Honeydew was started by David Futoran (Wharton) and the dermatologist who cleared his skin, Joel Spitz, MD (Princeton, Columbia), after David spent years struggling to access care.

Opportunity 📈

This is an opportunity to join our team, lead our people function, and help us build and manage a world-class team as we clear the Earth of skin diseases.

Honeydew’s Head of People will work closely with David, our CEO, and other functional leaders.

Currently, we're looking for someone to start fractionally and ultimately transition to a full-time role within 6 months or less.

What you’ll work on:

  • Building our HR and People operations function from the ground up

  • Overseeing state-by-state employment compliance

  • Owning compensation, benefits, and policy at Honeydew

  • Creating a world-class recruiting process and pipeline

  • Running performance and manager development

  • Supporting leadership with org structure strategy

  • Ensuring our people are well supported as we scale

Who you are:

  • 4+ years of experience leading a people function

  • High EQ and comfortable guiding everyone from entry-level employees to senior leaders

  • Practical and focused on what matters, vs creating unnecessary admin work

  • Can flex between rolling up your sleeves and running payroll or writing a policy to providing strategic guidance on org structure

  • Hungry to be a part of building a generational company

  • Someone who enjoys working at a fast-paced startup

jobs.title: Operations Support Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Role
We’re seeking a highly adaptable Operations Support Specialist to provide flexible coverage across our operations team. This role ensures continuity by stepping in when team members are out - handling faxes, membership emails, failed payments, product orders, and other essential workflows. When coverage isn’t needed, you’ll contribute to projects that improve efficiency, update processes, and strengthen the patient experience.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide reliable coverage for core workflows, including:

    • Processing and routing faxes.

    • Managing membership-related emails and patient communications.

    • Investigating and resolving failed payments.

    • Fulfilling and tracking product orders.

  • Ensure accuracy, timeliness, and excellent service in every task, regardless of assignment.

  • Support smaller projects when not providing coverage, such as:

    • Process documentation and SOP updates.

    • Data entry, reporting, and workflow improvements.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve operational issues quickly and effectively.

  • Serve as a dependable, go-to resource who can adapt to new workflows and step in as needed.

What We’re Looking For

  • 1–3 years of experience in business operations, administrative support, or healthcare services.

  • Highly adaptable with the ability to quickly learn and switch between tasks.

  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

  • Problem-solving mindset with the ability to manage unexpected tasks smoothly.

  • Bonus: experience in healthcare operations, billing, or patient/member support.

Why Join Us
This role is designed for someone who thrives on variety, flexibility, and being the “glue” that keeps operations running smoothly. You’ll gain exposure to many aspects of the business, play a critical role in ensuring continuity of care and service, and contribute both to daily operations and long-term improvements. For the right person, this is a chance to have a broad impact while growing into a key member of a fast-moving healthcare company.

jobs.title: Creative Producer - Video & Design
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Mission 💪

Our mission is to ensure that no one in the world has to suffer from a treatable skin disease because of an access issue ever again.

About Honeydew 👋

Honeydew is building a platform for hundreds of millions of people globally to access expertise and science-backed skin treatments, from prescription to retail.

Our tech-forward dermatology experience helps people with chronic skin conditions access licensed specialists, FDA-approved treatment, and ongoing support in record time (24 hours vs an industry average of 6 months).

Honeydew is the future of skin health — digitally native, scientifically rooted, integrated end-to-end (evaluation + treatments + lab tests), and powered by AI.

Opportunity 📈

We're looking for a performance-minded Creative Producer who specializes in building high-impact paid social ads. In this role, you’ll play a key part in fueling Honeydew's acquisition engine by producing compelling video and static content for platforms like Meta, TikTok, YouTube, and Snap. You’ll own the end-to-end creative process—from conceptualization to execution—transforming raw footage and ideas into scroll-stopping ads that convert.

This is a hands-on role for a creative who can edit video, design engaging statics, and ideally craft sharp ad copy that grabs attention and inspires action. Working closely with channel owners and fellow creatives, you’ll have a direct impact on driving patient acquisition and shaping how our brand shows up across digital channels.

You’ll report to our Head of Growth (Connor Kreutz) who’s based in New York City.

We're offering a salary range of $110,000-130,000 for this role, as well as:

  • equity in Honeydew

  • flexible PTO

  • great health, vision, and dental insurance

  • 401k w/ match

  • One Medical membership

  • a company MacBook & internet stipend

What you’ll work on:

  • Edit performance-driven ads: Create video and static assets for Meta, TikTok, Snap, and YouTube with strong hooks, platform-native style, fast pacing, emotional payoff, and clear CTAs.

  • Creative strategy ownership: Translate briefs into high-converting creative, balancing strategy, storytelling, and aesthetic execution. Contribute new concepts, formats, and editing approaches based on platform trends and performance data.

  • Influencer & UGC editing: Transform influencer and user-generated footage into polished, authentic ads that drive results.

  • Creative testing & iteration: Develop your own ad variants, propose structured experiments, help analyze results, and scale top-performing concepts.

  • Copywriting for performance: Write headlines, scripts, and on-screen text optimized for conversions, platform best practices, and brand voice.

  • Brand & visual identity: Contribute to Honeydew’s branding and organic social presence, ensuring storytelling and visuals remain consistent across channels.

  • Team collaboration & management: Partner closely with Growth team leadership to plan video / photo shoots to create high-product content. Oversee contract designers, editors, and photographers to deliver high-quality assets.

  • Thought leadership: Serve as a key voice in shaping Honeydew’s creative identity, working with the whole team to define how the brand engages and grows across platforms.

Who we’re looking for:

  • 3–5+ years of experience creating paid social ads and high-performing static creative for DTC, subscription, or high-growth brands.

  • Strong portfolio of direct-response video and static ads with measurable performance results, especially on TikTok, Meta, YouTube Shorts, and Snap.

  • Expertise in editing & design: Skilled in Adobe Premiere (After Effects a plus) and Photoshop (light retouching, background extensions, product adjustments). Strong grasp of typography, layout, color theory, and digital design principles.

  • Direct-response storytelling: Ability to craft platform-native content with strong hooks, momentum, and clear CTAs—turning briefs, UGC, and influencer content into polished, authentic, high-converting ads.

  • Strategic and analytical: Adept at reading briefs, understanding KPIs, and developing creative that ladders up to growth and business objectives. Comfortable contributing to copywriting and iterating on messaging.

  • Collaborative operator: Works effectively both independently and in cross-functional teams. Organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced, testing-heavy environment.

  • Creative self-starter: Proactive, adaptable, and culturally attuned—eager to ideate, experiment, and push creative boundaries. Comfortable articulating design decisions with strategic reasoning.

  • Bonus: Experience writing high-performing ad copy and/or familiarity with Motion, Triple Whale, or creative analytics platforms.

Location: NYC or willing to relocate to the New York City area. This is a hybrid role. We expect you to be in-person at our NoMad office 2-3 days a week.

If this doesn’t seem right for you, but you know a good candidate, please forward this along!

More about Honeydew ⭐

Honeydew was started by David Futoran (Wharton) and the dermatologist who cleared his skin, Joel Spitz, MD (Princeton, Columbia), after David spent years struggling to access care.

Since launching, Honeydew has helped 20,000+ people achieve life-changing results with a 5-star rating, and we are growing 5x YoY.

Honeydew is building a platform for hundreds of millions of people globally to access expertise and science-backed skin treatments, from prescription to retail.

Our tech-forward dermatology experience helps people with chronic skin conditions access licensed specialists, FDA-approved treatment, and ongoing support in record time (24 hours vs an industry average of 6 months).

Honeydew is the future of skin health — digitally native, scientifically rooted, integrated end-to-end (evaluation + treatments + lab tests), and powered by AI.

Why this role matters

We’re a consumer product that must feel effortless and human—and a healthcare product that must be precise, compliant, and reliable. You’ll turn complex, regulated workflows into experiences that millions can navigate with confidence. This is a high-impact, zero-to-one role: you’ll set the bar for product quality, design systems, and customer trust.

What you’ll do

  • Own core journeys end-to-end: onboarding, evaluation/intake, image capture, asynchronous consults, lab flows, prescription and fulfillment, payments/subscription, refills/adherence, and results/education.

  • Simplify complexity: translate insurance, pricing, and regulatory constraints (consents, Rx-only flows) into clear steps and plain language.

  • Build a cohesive design system: foundations, components, accessibility, motion; scale across web, app, and care ops tools.

  • Prototype fast, validate smarter: Figma prototypes, moderated/unmoderated tests, event instrumentation, and A/B tests to learn quickly.

  • Partner deeply: work with Clinical, Care Ops, Growth, and Engineering to ship on schedule and measure outcomes.

  • Champion quality: sweat microcopy, states, and edge cases; make “hard things obvious” without losing warmth or brand.

  • Build the function: establish rituals (critiques, research cadence, metrics reviews) and mentor contractors as we scale.

What success looks like (examples)

You’ll help drive measurable improvements across patient experience and team efficiency, such as:

  • Higher retention (M1/M3), better treatment plan adherence, and improved NPS.

  • Conversion rates from intake flows up 25%.

  • Treatment delays down 30%; fewer support contacts and less customer confusion.

  • A documented, accessible design system used across product and care ops.

What we’re looking for

  • 6+ years in product design with shipped consumer UX/UI; experience in healthcare or other regulated, workflow-heavy domains strongly preferred.

  • Portfolio that shows systems thinking and crisp execution: you’ve simplified multi-step flows into intuitive UI and moved key metrics.

  • Strong product instincts for consumer health or subscription funnels: onboarding, paywalls, lifecycle, and engagement loops.

  • Proficiency in Figma (components, variants, auto-layout), prototyping (high-fidelity clickthroughs), and usability testing.

  • Comfort with data and research: define success metrics, run scrappy studies, collaborate on event schemas, and iterate quickly.

  • Accessibility fluency (WCAG), content design chops, and strong visual craft.

  • Low-ego collaborator who can alternate between IC execution and strategic thinking.

  • Comfortable using and adapting across different tools (design, data, testing) — versatility and speed are key in our environment.

  • Experience with or openness to AI tools and workflows; ideally someone who can experiment rapidly and use new technology to accelerate design work.

Nice to have

  • Experience with care team tools (inbox, triage, scheduling, escalations).

  • Familiarity with HIPAA-sensitive design patterns and informed consent flows.

  • Motion/micro-interaction skills to make complex flows feel light.

Compensation and benefits

  • $150,000-$200,000, meaningful equity, flexible PTO, great medical/vision/dental, 401k w/ match, One Medical, MacBook + stipend.

How we hire

  1. Application review

  2. Portfolio deep dive

  3. Intro call

  4. Technical screening

  5. Cross-functional interviews

  6. References and offer

More about Honeydew ⭐

Honeydew was started by David Futoran (Wharton) and the dermatologist who cleared his skin, Joel Spitz, MD (Princeton, Columbia), after David spent years struggling to access care.

Since launching, Honeydew has helped 20,000+ people achieve life-changing results with a 5-star rating, and we are growing 5x YoY.
